page.title: 12LANDSCAPE - THREE MOSSES
page.content: There are a few small coppices in this area comprising mixed trees, such as Beech, Sycamore, Hawthorn and Rhododendron affording cover to the pheasants, patridge and other small game birds that abound here. Wood pigeons abound and Collared Doves are now a cause for concern when they descend on the grain or brassicas grown here, although the later have been a protected species for sometime. All sorts of wild geese and ducks invade this area to graze, flying in from the Wildlife Reserve at Martin Mere. Some control of these birds in the form of gas controlled bird scarers and other devices are used. Part of the old Cheshire Lines Railway is now a wild life conservation area, encouraging wild flowers, birds etc.,There are no hedges as wind breaks in the area.
